availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Anderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Son of Jane McCall. Married to Mary Smith McCall on February 18, 1858. Father of Elizabeth J. McCall and Martha B. McCall. Farmer in Anderson County in 1850 and 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in 1850 and two in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 207; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 29; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, p. 28; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Anderson County, District 1, p. 25; Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records â€“ Microfilm (1852-1910), Microfilm rolls #994027-994058, Anderson County, Kentucky, Marriages, February 18, 1858, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky.
